src_text: Merero ye e lego ditabeng seemong sa bjale Kabinete e amoget e Lekala la 6 la Sete e sa Mohlagase sa Medupi ka Lephalale, Limpopo ge le thomile go
trg_text: Current issues Cabinet welcomed Unit 6 of Medupi Power Station in Lephalale, Limpopo coming into full commercial operation and contributing 800 megawatts (MW) power into the national gri The Medupi Power Station Project is a greenfield coal-fired power plant comprising six units rated in total at 4 764 MW installed capacit President Jacob Zuma will launch this unit on 30 August 2015.Construction of the Medupi Power Station started in May 2007 and all six units are expected to be operational in the first half of 2019.

src_text: oma bjalo ka la kgwebo ebile le eba le seabe sa mohlagase wa dimekawate t e 800 (MW) ka gare ga mothopo wa mohlagase maemong a boset hab Prot eke ya Sete e sa Mohlagase sa Medupi ke polante ye e hlokago mapheko ya mohlagase wa go fehlwa ka malahla ye e nago le makala a tshela ao a et wego gore a na le palomoka ya bokgoni bja go t welet a 4 764 M Mopresidente Jacob Zuma o tla thakgola semmu o lekala le ka la 30 Phato 2015.Go agwa ga Sete e sa Mohlagase sa Medupi go thomilwe ka Mosegamanye 2007 gomme makala a sona ka moka a tshela go emet we gore a tla be a
trg_text: Once completed, it will be the fourth largest coal-fired plant and the largest dry-cooled power station in the worl The planned operational life of the power station is 50 yearUnit 6 was first synchronised to the national grid on 2 March this year and has been supplying electricity to the national grid intermittently whilst undergoing regular optimisation test During this period Unit 6 has been able to alleviate pressure on the national electricity system, helping to either avoid load-shedding altogether or minimise its severit The unit s commercial operation has been achieved, well within the normally stipulated period of six months after first synchronisatioThe commercial operation of Unit 6 of the Medupi Power Station is a critical milestone in our effort to build new generating capacit Cabinet further appreciated the current constraints the country still faces on the power suppl While load-shedding is regrettable, Eskom is committed to perform the necessary maintenance to improve the long-term health of our plants with reasonable disruption Next Monday (31 August), Unit 2 of the Koeberg Power Station in the Western Cape will be shut down for planned maintenanc The unit is expected to return to service after three month The scheduled shutdown of Koeberg Unit 2 is part of Eskom s overall maintenance programme for its fleet of power station Every 16 to 18 months, each of the two units at Koeberg is shut down for refueling, inspection and maintenanc The routine shutdowns are scheduled so as to avoid having both units out of service at the same time and to avoid the winter months in each yea Whilst we continue to make progress in improving our electricity generation capacity, Cabinet calls on South Africans to continue using electricity sparingly Summit of Heads of State and Government Cabinet welcomed the outcomes from the 35th Ordinary Southern African Development Community (SADC) Summit of Heads of State and Government, wherein President Zuma led the South African delegatioThe summit adopted the revised Regional Indicative Strategic Development Plan 2015-2020.

trg_text: Our indigenous knowledge, our heritage: Towards the identification, promotion and preservation of South African s living heritage .This year s commemoration will take the format of a cultural fair and communities are encouraged to use their living heritage such as food, craft, dance and music to promote cultural diversity, human rights, nation-building and economic developmen South Africa will also celebrate Tourism Month in September, which is an opportune time for families to visit the country s heritage sites to reconnect with our pasDuring Heritage Month, the Department of Arts and Culture will undertake a sod turning on the National Heroes Acre in Pretoria to signal the start of construction of a national monument that will depict the pre-colonial era, liberation struggle and the different heroes who fought for social progres The annual South African Police Service (SAPS) National Commemoration Day on 6 September 2015 at the Union Buildings in Pretoria will celebrate the courage and dedication of officers who paid the ultimate price to protect communitieThrough the SAPS recruitment campaign an additional 6 252 members will be enlisted during the 2015/16 financial year to enhance detective services, visible policing, crime intelligence, forensic services, including protection and security serviceCabinet calls on our youth to consider a career in the SAPS, which offers numerous opportunitie More information can be obtained on wwsapgoz The annual Public Service Month will take place across the Public Service in September under the theme

trg_text: These agreements will allow the Inter-State Defence and Security Committee of the Organ on Politics, Defence and Security Cooperation to serve as a coordinating forum for the Chiefs of Corrections and Prisons in Southern AfricDeclaration on Youth Development and Empowerment draws attention to the urgency of youth development and empowerment in the context of regional cooperation, integration, development and peace, and security in the regioProtocol on Trade Services to liberalise intra-SADC trade in services with a view to creating a single market for services in the regio The adoption of the Revised Regional Indicative Strategic Development Plan 2015-2020 was a major milestone in SADC s endeavors to promote intra-regional tradCabinet also welcomed the decision of the SADC Double Troika meeting, held on the margins of the SADC Summit attended by Deputy President and SADC Facilitator Cyril Ramaphosa, to reaffirm the current terms of reference for the SADC Commission of Inquiry into the Kingdom of Lesotho Visit to Japan by Deputy President Cabinet welcomed the successful visit of Deputy President Ramaphosa to Japa He was accompanied by a high-level ministerial and business delegation to promote South Africa as a preferred investment destinatioThe Deputy President reassured Japanese investors that South Africa was open for business and briefed them on the country s sound macro-economic stability and conducive business environment for investment, particularly in ventures that create jobDeputy President Ramaphosa also used the visit to secure commitments from Japan to partner with South Africa in its efforts to combat the scourge of HIV and AIDS, TB and Malaria Key Cabinet decisions Cabinet approved the bid of South Africa and the City of Durban to host the 2022 Commonwealth Game This is the first time that Africa will host the Commonwealth Games and will position South Africa as a sport tourism destination and also provide opportunities for Team South AfricHosting will also make use of the infrastructure legacy of the 2010 FIFA World Cup .The 2022 Commonwealth Games is expected to deliver up to R20 billion in output to the economy, translating into an additional R11 billion GDP growt Cabinet approved the publication of South Africa s 5th Periodic Report (2009-2014) on the Implementation of the Convention on the Elimination of all Forms of Discrimination against Women in the Government Gazette, for public commenThe report provides an overview of the effectiveness of the range of laws, policies and programmes implemented in South Africa and highlights the achievements the country has made on women s empowerment and gender equalit The report also recognises the persistent challenges and barriers to overcoming inequality and discrimination in the countr Cabinet approved for South Africa to join the Advisory Centre on World Trade Organisation (WTO) Law in GenevThis is an international organisation that provides legal advice on WTO law, support in WTO dispute settlement proceedings and training in WTO law to developing and least developed countrieAs a member South Africa will be able to source advice on the compatibility of trade measures of other countries that affect South African exports and of trade measures that South Africa wants to introduc The centre can also assist South Africa in WTO dispute settlement case Cabinet was briefed on the Minister of Finance, Mr Nhlanhla Nene, assuming the Presidency of the Council of Ministers of the Eastern and Southern Africa Anti-Money Laundering Group, for a yea As a result the Minister will host the 2015 annual meeting of the counciThe regional intergovernmental body promotes consistent implementation of measures to combat money laundering and the financing of terrorism across the southern and eastern Africa regioThe aim of South Africa s membership is to strengthen measures regionally against money laundering and financing of terrorism, which promotes national security both domestically and regionall Cabinet continues to condemn the senseless killing of police officer Cabinet calls on members of public to work with the police in assisting to arrest the perpetrators of these killing The law-enforcement agencies are working round the clock to ensure all the perpetrators of these criminal acts are apprehende Cabinet thanks the members of the public who contributed to the arrest of the three people linked to police killings Bills Cabinet approved the submission of the Foreign Service Bill, 2015 to ParliamenThe Bill provides for a single Foreign Service system and creates an enabling legislative framework through which the current Foreign Service will be managed and regulated by the Department of International Relations and CooperatioThe Bill will be operationalised in the context of the Constitution, existing legislations applicable to the Public Service, security services and it is aligned to the NDP in enhancing service deliverThis will enhance efficiency, accountability and cost-effectiveness of capitalizing on opportunities abroad to advance South Africa s foreign policy and developmental agend Cabinet approved the tabling of the Traditional and Khoisan Leadership Bill, 2015 in Parliamen The Bill contributes to the NDP s key target of broadening social cohesion and unity while addressing the inequalities of the past by providing for the statutory recognition of the Khoisan communities and leaderIt proposes the establishment of an Advisory Committee on Khoisan matters which will assist government with the recognition process relating to Khoisan communities and leaderThe Bill also consolidates existing national traditional leadership legislation which will result in the repeal of the National House of Traditional Leaders Act, 2009 (Act 22 of 2009) and the Traditional Leadership and Governance Framework Act, 2003 (Act 41 of 2003) Upcoming events President Zuma will launch the War on Water Leaks project, announced in his 2015 State of the Nation Address, in Port Elizabeth on 28 August 2015, as part of government s programme to address water loss from leakThe project will train 15 000 young people as artisans and plumbers to fix leaks within their communities; it will give them skills to start their own businesses or find suitable employmen The first intake of 3 000 is being recruited for the current financial yeaWater leaks account for nearly 40 per cent of the nation s water loss and costs the country R7 billion a yea President Zuma will attend the 70th Anniversary of the End of the Occupation of China and World War II in the People s Republic of China (PRC) from 2 to 4 September 2015, and will have a bilateral engagement with President Xi JinpinSouth Africa s relations with the PRC is at the level of a Comprehensive Strategic Partnership underpinned by the Beijing Declaration on the Establishment of a Comprehensive Strategic Partnership, which covers all relations between the two countrie

src_text: SADC Cyril Ramaphosa, go tii et a leswa melawana ya t hupet o ya bjale ya Khomi ene ya Dinyaki i o ya SADC mabapi le Naga ya Kgo i ya Lesotho Ketelo ya Japan ka Motlat amopresidente Kabinete e amoget e ketelo ye e atlegilego ka Motlat amopresidente Ramaphosa go la Japa O be a felegedit we ke baromiwa ba maemo a godimo ba ditona le ba kgwebo go kwalakwat a Afrika Borwa bjalo ka lefelo leo le ratwago la go etelwMotlat amopresidente o netefaledit e babeelet i ba Japan gore Afrika Borwa e bulet we kgwebo le go ba sedimo a ka ga seemo sa go hloka mathata sa ekonomi ye kgolo ya ka nageng le bjalo ka tikologo ye e loket ego kgwebo, kudukudu ka masolong ao a hlomago me omMotlat amopresidente Ramaphosa o ile a kgopela gore ketelo yeo e hwet e boikgafo go Japan gore e diri ane le Afrika Borwa ka masolong a yona a go fedi a leuba la HIV le AIDS, TB le Letadi Diphetho t e Bohlokwa t a Kabinete Kabinete e dumelet e phenkgi ano ya Afrika Borwa le Toropokgolo ya Durban ya go swara Dipapadi t a Commonwealth t a 2022.

src_text: omago ka go Tirelo ya Set haba, ditirelo t a t hirelet o ebile o amant hit we le Leanotlhabollo la Boset haba (NDP) go maatlafat a kabo ya ditirelSe se tla maatlafat a bokgoni bja go dira mo omo, boikarabelo le go seket a ma eleng ge go diri wa matlotlo ka dibakeng t a dinageng t a ka ntle go phethagat a molawana wa dinaga t a ka ntle wa Afrika Borwa le lenaneo la tlhaboll Kabinete e dumelet e go alwa ga Molaokakanywa wa Set o le Boetapele bja MaKhoisan, wa 2015 ka Palamenten Molaokakanywa wo o tsenya letsogo ka go nepi o ye bohlokwa ya NDP ya mabapi le go katolo a tiri ano ya set haba le setee mola ka go le lengwe e rarolla tlhokego ya tekatekano ya mo nakong ye e fetilego ka go fa temogo ya semolao ya dit haba t a MaKhoisa le baetapele ba t onE

src_text: i inya go hlongwa ga Komiti ya Kelet o ka ga metlagorero ya MaKhoisan yeo e tlago thu a mmu o go lemoga tshepedi o ya mabapi le dit haba t a MaKhoisan le baetapele ba t onMolaokakanywa wo o tii et a melao ye e lego gona ya boetapele bja set o bja boset haba gomme o tla felet a ka go fedi wa ga Molao wa Boset haba wa Ntlo ya Mago i, ka 2009 (Molao wa 22 wa 2009) le Molao wa Tlhako ya Boetapele bja Set o le Pu o, wa 2003 (Molao wa 41 wa 2003) Ditiragalo t e di tlago Mopresidente Zuma o tla tsebagat a semmu o Prot eke ya Twant ho ya go Dutla ga Meetse, yeo e tlago tsebagat wao ka Polelong ya gagwe ya Maemo a Naga ya 2015, ka Port Elizabeth ka la 28 Phato 2015, bjalo ka karolo ya lenaneo la mmu o la go rarolla tahlegelo ya meetse ka lebaka la go dutla ga on Prot eke ye e tla hlahla bafsa ba 15 000 bjalo ka ba omi ba me omo ya diatla bao ba nago le tsebo le dipholampara go loki a go dutla ga meetse ka metseng ya bona; se se tla ba fa bokgoni bja go thoma dikgwebo t a bona goba go hwet a mo omo wa maleb Go t ewa ga bafsa ba mathomo ba 3 000 go a dirwa mo ngwageng wo wa dit heletGo dutla ga meetse go bopa dipersente t e di nyakilego go ba t e 40
trg_text: iSimangaliso Board:a) Mr Paul Ndukuzempi Buyani Zwane

src_text: t a tahlego ya meets nageng ka bophara gomme go jela naga R7 pilione ka ngwag Mopresidente Zuma o tla tsenela Moletlo wa Segopot o sa bo 70 sa Mafelelo a go Tsena ga China le Ntwa ya Lefase ya Bobedi ka Repabliking ya China (PRC) go thoma ka la 2 go fihla ka la 4 Lewedi 2015, gomme o tla ba le ditheri ano t a bobedi le Mopresidente Xi JinpinDikamano t a Afrika Borwa le PRC di maemong a Selekane sa Togamaano ya Kakaret o seo se thekgilwego ke Kwano ya Beijing ka ga Go Hlongwa ga Selekane sa Togamaano ya Kakaret o, seo se akaret ago dikamano ka moka magareng ga dinaga ka bobed

src_text: Tsebo ya rena ya setlogo, bohwa bja rena: Re lebile go tsebo, go t wet o pele le go lota bohwa bjo bo phelago bja Afrika Borwa .Moketeko wa ngwaga wo o tla ba ka mokgwa wa tiragalo ya set o gomme dit haba di hlohlelet wa go
trg_text: Forests and People: Investing in a Sustainable Future

src_text: omi a bohwa bja t ona bjo bo phelago bja go swana le dijo, bokgabo, go bina le mmino go t wet a pele pharologano ya set o, ditokelo t a botho, kago ya set haba le tlhabollo ya ekonom Afrika Borwa e tla keteka gape Kgwedi ya Boeti ka Lewedi, e lego nako ya maleba ya gore ba malapa ba etele mafelo a bohwa a ka nageng go kgokagana leswa le ditiragalo t e di fetileg Ka Kgwedi ya Bohwa, Kgoro ya Bokgabo le Set o e tla phetola mobu ka Lefelong la Bagale ba Ntwa la Boset haba ka Pretoria go laet a go thomi wa ga go aga ga monyumente wa boset haba wo o tlago laet a lebaka la nako ya pele ga bokoloniale, ntwa ya go lwela tokologo le bagale bao ba fapafapanego
trg_text: (re-appointment and Deputy Chairperson);c) Mr Rowan Graham Nicholls

src_text: gomme o ipilet a go MaAfrika Borwa go bjala mohlare o tee fela lehono le go thu a go beelet a ka go bokamoso bja go ya go ile Molaet a wa ditebogi o Kabinete e rata go lakalet a baraloki ba diatleletiki bao ba phadi anago ka Phadi anong ya Diatleletiki ya bo 15 ya Bonkgwete bja Lefase ye mo lebakeng le e swaret wego ka Beijing, China le bao ba kgathago tema ka Dipapading t a bo 11 t a All-Africa magareng ga la 4 le la 19 Lewedi 2015 ka Brazzaville, CongKabinete e ipilet a go MaAfrika Borwa go kopana go thekga baraloki ba diatleletiki ge ba fofi et a folaga ya rena godimo le go dira gore set haba se ikgant h Kabinete e ba le Mopresidente Zuma go lebogi a baga i ba SABC Dennis Tshetlhane le Sam Msibi ge ba thopile Legoro la Boga i bja Thelebi ene la Difoka t a Kga o ya SADC, le moithuti wa sekolo se se phagamego Imbelani Matibe ge a thopile Phadi ano ya SADC ya Legoro la Ditaodi o t a Sekol Kabinete e leboga MaAfrika Borwa ka moka ao a tsenet ego meketeko ya Kgwedi ya Basad
trg_text: (Chairperson);b) Mr JRD Modise
